intro: Hieracium atelesanthum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Hieracium atelesanthum is often considered a weed but plays a role in supporting pollinators and soil stability.
